panel.title: Advanced filters
panel.subtitle: Combine filters to refine the board view.

assignees.title: Assignees
assignees.hint: Include ‚ÄúNo assignee‚Äù to target unassigned cards.

search.title: Smart search
search.body: Type three characters or more and the lookup runs automatically. Use @sam to target people, #42 to jump to a card ID, and !high to filter by priority.
search.hint: Stack quick filters or advanced filters with the query to narrow the board in seconds.
search.info: Search text, short IDs, people and priorities from one field.

mine.title: My tasks
mine.body: Keeps only the cards where you appear in the RACI. Great for your personal focus time.
mine.info: Filters the board to cards where you're part of the RACI.

priority.title: Priority sort
priority.body: Reorders every column so the highest priority cards float to the top.
priority.info: Sorts each column by priority from highest to lowest.

dueDate.title: Due-date sort
dueDate.body: Sorts each column by upcoming deadlines so the most urgent cards are surfaced first.
dueDate.info: Orders columns by the nearest due dates first.

expert.title: Expert mode
expert.body: Shows the extra tabs in the task drawer (time tracking, automation, integrations) by default.
expert.hint: Disable it during onboarding if you want a simpler editor.
expert.info: Toggles advanced tabs inside the task drawer.

filtersButton.title: Advanced filters
filtersButton.body: Opens the advanced panel where you can stack criteria to display only the cards you need.
filtersButton.hint: Perfect for preparing a ritual, a review, or a themed board export.
filtersButton.info: Opens the advanced filter panel to combine multiple criteria.

assignees.title: Users
assignees.body: Select one or several teammates and the board keeps only their cards.
assignees.hint: Search by full name, initials or email to go faster.

priorities.title: Priorities
priorities.body: Toggle a badge to display only the matching priority and hide the rest.
priorities.hint: Activate multiple badges to craft an intermediate slice.
priorities.info: Quickly isolate one or more priorities on the board.

options.title: Options
options.body: Hide DONE columns or focus on cards that drive a child kanban.
options.hint: Useful for leadership reviews where you want zero visual noise.
options.info: Adjust the global view (DONE columns, child kanban cards, etc.).

effort.title: Effort
effort.body: Filter by effort (XS to XXL) to surface light, medium or heavy tasks depending on your capacity.
effort.hint: Combine it with the search bar to assemble a targeted work batch.
effort.info: Focus on a specific effort level.

columns.title: Column height
columns.body: Pick fixed columns with an internal scrollbar or infinite columns that extend with the page scroll.
columns.hint: Choose whichever feels better for your meetings or live workshops.
columns.info: Switch between automatic and fixed heights depending on the context.

display.title: Card details
display.body: Show or hide elements on the cards (ID, effort, priority, child kanban‚Ä¶).
display.hint: Build the perfect view for executives or keep all the insights for the squad.
display.info: Control which fields stay visible on each card.

add.title: Create a column
add.body: Click the plus button to add a new column, then describe how it should behave.
add.hint: You can adjust the configuration later without losing any card.

name.title: Column name
name.body: Give the column a clear label. You can rename it at any time.

behavior.title: Behavior
behavior.body:
Every behavior brings its own automation:
‚Ä¢ Backlog: archive after N days, extend with the ‚ÄúKeep‚Äù action or hide cards temporarily with Snooze.
‚Ä¢ In progress: a classic stage with no extra automation.
‚Ä¢ Blocked: add who is blocking, send reminder emails and set the reminder frequency.
‚Ä¢ Done: move completed cards to the archive after the delay you choose.
behavior.hint: Duplicate behaviors to map several lanes (e.g. ‚ÄúIn progress‚Äù, ‚ÄúIn testing‚Äù, ‚ÄúQA‚Äù).

wip.title: WIP limit
wip.body: Cap the number of cards allowed at the same time in this column. Leave it empty for no limit.

name.title: Column name
name.body: Update the label to reflect a new step or a parallel workflow.

wip.title: WIP limit
wip.body: Tighten or relax the WIP limit when the team capacity changes.

backlogArchive.title: Auto-archive (Backlog)
backlogArchive.body: Choose after how many inactive days backlog cards move to the archive automatically.
backlogArchive.hint: Set 0 to disable it. Use Snooze or the ‚ÄúKeep‚Äù button on the card to extend the timer.

doneArchive.title: Auto-archive (Done)
doneArchive.body: Define when completed cards leave the DONE column to keep it tidy.
doneArchive.hint: Keeps the column readable while preserving the history in the archive.

id.title: Short ID
id.body: The short number (#55) makes it easy to reference the card in a meeting or in search.

priority.title: Priority badge
priority.body: Color-coded priority that matches the quick filters and column sorting.
priority.info: Shows the urgency level used for sorting and dashboards.

menu.title: Quick actions
menu.body: Open, rename, move to another board or delete the card.
menu.hint: Handy when drag-and-drop is not practical or you need advanced actions.
menu.info: Opens shortcuts to edit, move or archive the card.

assignees.title: Owners
assignees.body: Initials highlight the main assignee. Hover to reveal the full RACI matrix.
assignees.hint: R = Responsible, A = Accountable, C = Consulted, I = Informed.
assignees.info: Hover the avatars to view each RACI role.

dueDate.title: Due date
dueDate.body: Shows the days remaining before the target date or the delay once it is overdue.
dueDate.hint: Green = on track, orange = at risk, red = late.
dueDate.info: Highlights remaining days or lateness at a glance.

progress.title: Progress
progress.body: Completion in percent, synced with subtasks and workflow updates.
progress.info: Live completion synced with subtasks and status changes.

effort.title: Effort
effort.body: Effort letter (XS to XXL) that reflects the expected complexity of the card.
effort.info: Relative estimate from XS to XXL used in planning.

fractal.title: Child kanban
fractal.body: This card hosts a dedicated child kanban. The numbers show Backlog, In progress, Blocked and Done counts.
fractal.hintExisting: Click to open the child board and follow its progress.
fractal.hintCreate: If no board exists yet, we will create it instantly for you.
fractal.info: Summarises the linked child kanban status counts.

tooltip.title: üí° Discovery mode
tooltip.body: Turn this mode on to display explanatory tooltips across the interface.
tooltip.hint: Ideal for onboarding and training. Tooltips with dynamic data remain visible regardless.
